title: The Demons of Red Lodge and Other Stories
author: Jason Arnopp, Rick Briggs, William Gallagher, John Dorney
filename: 142 - The Demons of Red Lodge and Other Stories - Jason Arnopp, Rick Briggs, William Gallagher, John Dorney_djvu.txt

elements.text: SCENE 1: INT. WOODSHED
(FX: WOODLAND AMBIENCE OUTSIDE — CREEPY WIND, STRAIGHT OUT OF
‘THE EVIL DEAD’ )
Nyssa. Nyssa! Wake up. Nyssa!
(WAKING WITH A START) Doctor? (BEAT) Where — where are we?
I haven’t the faintest idea. I only just came to myself.
How did we get here? I can’t remember. (REALISATION) Doctor, I can’t remember!
(PLAYING HIS OWN ANXIETY DOWN THROUGHOUT) Try not to worry.
It’s so dark. I can’t see a thing.
Perhaps someone forgot to pay the electricity bill. How do you feel?
Scared. Like I can’t breathe properly. You?
Let’s just stay calm and take this one step at a time, shall we? Take my hand. See if we can’t get up.
FX: THEY STAGGER TO THEIR FEET
My arms and legs ache.
Mine too. Now, this seems to be a rather confined [space] — (STUMBLES ON A PILE OF LOGS) Oww!
FX: LOGS ROLL AWAY
NYSSA3: What was that? Doctor?
Logs. I think we’re in a woodshed.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 3
I want to get out of here, but I’m afraid to leave. What’s wrong with me?

As I said, Nyssa, slow down. Stay calm. Something has jangled our nerves, but everything’s fine. (BEAT) Ah, here we are. A wall - you find another and we’1ll soon locate the door. (FORCED CHUCKLE) Either that, or we’ll bash our heads together.
Doctor... Do you feel it? This terrible sense of [panic —]
(CUTTING IN HARSHLY) Nyssa! Please! Focus! (BEAT) I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to raise my voice. Just... breathe deeply. In through the nose, out through the mouth.
TAKES A COUPLE OF DEEP BREATHS
Better?
Much. I wish I knew how we got here. I can’t even remember where we are — in time and space, I mean.
No, neither can I. But I’m sure the information won’t evade us forever. (REACHING OUT TO WALLS) In the meantime, keep searching the walls.
BEAT
Got it.
(COMING OVER) The door?
(FX: SHE RATTLES THE DOOR HANDLE: IT’S LOCKED) Locked.
Now there’s a surprise. (FX: KNOCKING ON DOOR) It’s a wooden door, so... (STEPPING BACK) Stand back, Nyssa! (FX: RUNS AT DOOR. IMPACT ON DOOR) Nnnghhh!
CONTINUES INTO:
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 2: EXT. WOODS (CONTINUOUS)
(FX: WOODSHED DOOR BURSTS OPEN WITH A CRACK. DOCTOR RUNS A FEW PACES. CREEPY WIND MORE PROMINENT, BLOWING TREES)
Barely any brighter out here, I’m afraid. Tall trees, precious little moon. And this mist really isn’t helping.
FX: NYSSA’S FEET ON LEAVES
My eyes are still adjusting. Where are you?
Right here.
Doctor, can I keep hold of your hand? I don’t know why, but...
Here. To be perfectly honest, it’1ll help steady my own [nerves] .. Well, anyway.
I’m starting to make out trees. And stars. Anything we can navigate by?
Hard to navigate when you don’t know your destination. The
could be anywhere.
FX: DISTANT CRACK OF A BRANCH UNDERFOOT
(GASPS) What was that? Doctor, what was that?
(WHISPERS) Quiet, Nyssa. Quiet and still.
So hard to see through the mist. The sound came from over
there.
Let’s listen for a moment.
FX: LONG BEAT. WIND BLOWS. CRUNCH! FEET ON LEAVES
(CLOSE) Doctor, there’s something in the mist.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 5
(CLOSE) Yes, I see it too. A shadow. No... two shadows.
(CLOSE) They’re not moving. But they’re looking straight at us - I can feel it.
(CLOSE) Nyssa... you’re hurting my hand.
(CLOSE) You’re hurting mine.
FX: FEET ON LEAVES, CLOSER THAN BEFORE
(ALARMED) Did you hear that?
I only tend to say “Run!” when there’s a clear and present danger, but —
FX: FEET ON LEAVES, CLOSER THAN BEFORE
They’re getting closer!
Run!
FX: THEY RUN AWAY, ACROSS WOODLANDS. FADE
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 6
SCENE 3: EXT. WOODS (LATER)
FX: FADE UP. WIND PICKING UP
(RUNNING TO STOP, BREATHLESS) I really should play more cricket. Nyssa. Stop.
(RUNNING TO STOP, BREATHLESS) Can we afford to stop? Whatever- it-is is still behind us, I’m sure.
Whatever it is, I can’t believe we’re running from it without good reason.
(SEEING NOOSE ON TREE) Doctor...
What is it?
Up there, hanging from the tree?
Ah. It’s nothing, Nyssa. Just a length of rope.
It’s more than that, Doctor. It’s a noose.
Best we don’t dwell. Look - over there.
NYSSA3: What is it?
A cottage, on what appears to be the edge of a village. Looks rather smart.
What? With just one floor?
Size isn’t everything, Nyssa. Just ask the TARDIS when we relocate it. But perhaps we could shelter there ‘til daylight, when we might be more composed?
We don’t know who lives inside!
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 7
Nyssa, we have to fight this fear. We seem to be experiencing the same sense of... well, panic.
So you do feel it.
It must be artificially induced. It must. We have to bear that in mind... and get to that cottage as quickly as possible. (FX:
AWAY) Come on.
(FX: FOOTSTEPS AWAY) Wait for me.
(FX: THEIR FOOTSTEPS MOVING OFF... THEN ANOTHER PAIR OF
STEPPING IN, OVER TWIGS AND LEAVES. THEY STOP)
(UP CLOSE, ALIEN, COLD) See how they run.
(SAME VOICE) There is no need to pursue them further. They must recharge.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 8
SCENE 4: EXT. OUTSIDE COTTAGE
FX: URGENT KNOCKS ON WOODEN DOOR
Hello? Hello? Anyone home?
Doctor, I can see those shadows again, at the edge of the clearing. They’re watching us.
FX: DOCTOR KNOCKS AGAIN
Hello?
(FROM OTHER SIDE OF DOOR, WORKING CLASS SUFFOLK) Hold ye hard, sir.
Of course. Sorry if we’ve woken you.
FX: BOLTS SLIDE OPEN. THE DOOR CREAKS OPEN
Heavens! Your faces. Have ye the Devil on your tails?
I sincerely hope not. I’m the Doctor, this is Nyssa. We appear to have lost our way in the dark, and we were wondering —
Please, will you let us in?
Don’t want no trouble here. (FX: A FLINTLOCK PISTOL COCKS) Will I be needin’ this?
I can assure you there’s no call for a flintlock, or any other
weapon.
In you come, then.
FX: THE DOCTOR AND NYSSA PASS THROUGH DOOR INTO:
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 9
SCENE 5: INT. COTTAGE — MAIN ROOM (CONTINUOUS)
(FX: GENTLE CRACKLES OF LOW HEARTH FIRE. WIND THROUGH OPEN
DOOR)
We’re very grateful to you, Mrs...?
Miss Emily Cobham, sir.
Please — would you mind securing the door?
Very well.
FX: DOOR BOLTED AND LOCKED. WIND LOWER
Now then. What have we got here? My, but your clothes are queer.
You live alone, Miss Cobham?
(SAD) I soon will, Sir. Aye... that I will. Can I offer ye some pottage?
Most kind.
Thank you, but I’m afraid I’m not hungry. What did you mean, Emily, when you said — [soon you’1l live alone? ]
FX: CLANG OF COOKING POTS
I’1ll heat it up. Vegetables to go with it. Ivy and I have lived the life since our mistress passed away, God rest her soul.
Oh. You were servants, and now...?
Left her and the master’s cottage to us old maids. Imagine! The locals didn’t like that.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 10
Have you seen the rope outside?
The noose? Aye. Pay it no mind. Been there since Hopkins were around, twenty year back.
Hopkins?
I think Miss Cobham is referring to Matthew Hopkins - am I right?
Aye. The Witchfinder General himself.
And I’m now reminded where we are: Suffolk, 1665!
You were very trusting, to let us in.
Could hardly say no. I saw the fear in your faces.
Yes. Thank you. We’re stabilising now.
Then why look out the window, eyes so wide?
Curiosity.
We thought we saw.. people, out there, in the mist.

Some say Hopkins and his man John Stearne are still at large in the countryside, eyes full o’ God’s fury. Gliding through the mist in the dead of night, still hunting those with the Devil in their hearts. (BEAT) Sorry, ma’am, did I scare thee?
s-L’m-just a little cold; that’s. all.
It’s an improbable tale at best. Here, have a blanket round
your shoulders. Stew’s almost done.
FX: POT, KITCHEN CLATTER. AS IVY DISHES UP STEW
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 11
Where’s your friend Ivy tonight?
(DISHING UP) Ivy is my sister, Sir. My twin. Why God chooses to make me live longer, I can’t say I know.
Oh. You mean, Ivy’s..? (DOESN’T WANT TO SAY ‘DEAD’ )
Barely there, ma’am. Too weak to leave the bedroom. May not last the night.
I’m sorry.
No need. We’ve lived long in Red Lodge. Fifty year! A miracle for maids like us.
Red Lodge! So that’s where we are.
Is that the name of the cottage?
As I recall, Red Lodge is the name of the village. Emily, might I see your sister? There may be something I can do.
Won’t hear of it. (FX: BOWLS ON TABLE) Sit yourselves down, eat. (FX: SCRAPING CHAIRS)
Please. It’d be no trouble.
Eat, sir.
(FX: HE AND NYSSA SIT) Very well, Emily, but I won’t give up.
Fire’s burning low in the grate. (FX: EMILY UNLOCKS FRONT DOOR) Best fetch some wood.
3: Please — be careful —
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 12
FX: EMILY CLOSES DOOR BEHIND
Doctor, do you think she’s safe out there?
(REMEMBERING SOMETHING) Fire.
3: What?
Fire. The fire! Wheels turning, bells ringing. Nyssa, do you remember?
(SLOWLY) We were talking about fire. We’d just stepped out of the TARDIS, and we were talking about fire!
The Great Fire of London to be precise...
FX: CROSSFADE, OR REVERSE ECHO, INTO:
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 6: EXT. WOODS (FLASHBACK)
(FX: TARDIS MATERIALISES. WOODLAND ATMOS, NO WIND. TARDIS DOOR OPENS. )
(WALKING OUT) It’s 1665, Nyssa. A whole year yet, before Pudding Lane. Do keep up.
(FOLLOWING HIM) Do we really have to explore, every time we land somewhere unintended?
(FX: CLOSING TARDIS DOOR) He who never explores, Nyssa, will never truly find himself.
NYSSA3: Who said that?
Me, just then. I think that’s rather good, actually. (BEAT) Look — sunset. Isn’t that worth leaving the old box for?
If you say so, Doctov...
FX: NARRATION RUNS OVER:
(V/O) Doctor, it’s all coming back. As we looked at that
sunset...
(V/O) Yes. We were ambushed.
(FX: THICK BUBBLING SOUND AS AMORPHOUS SPEERA-BLOBS SWOOP DOWN TO ATTACK THEM)
What was that-?
FX: THE SLAP OF AMORPHOUS SPEERA-BLOBS ON FLESH
AHHHH!
(V/O) It was all a blur. But something struck the back of my neck...
FX: THE SLAP OF AMORPHOUS SPEERA-BLOBS ON FLESH
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL)
(V/O) Something with the texture of warm clay.
(V/O) And then that terrible hum.
FX: EERIE DRONING HUM OF SPEERA-ASSIMILATION
Doctor! There’s something on me. I can’t move!
Me too. Stay calm, Nyssa. Just... stay calm.
What are they doing, Doctor? Make them stop! Please, make
stop!
FX: CROSS BACK TO:
Page 14
them
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 15
SCENE 7: INT. COTTAGE — MAIN ROOM
FX: FADE UP. LOW HEARTH FIRE
(SOTTO) I can’t remember anything else. Until the woodshed.
(SOTTO) I don’t think I want to. But I’m feeling a little stronger.
Whatever happened to us must have induced both the fear and the memory loss, but both are fading. (FX: STANDING UP,
CHAIR) Nyssa — take a look at Ivy, would you? Let me know if anything can be done for her.
Of course. Where are you going?
To make sure Emily’s alright with that wood.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 16
SCENE 8: EXT. WOODS
FX: WIND HOWLS, WHISTLES
Hungry now. So very, very hungry. Fifty per cent is
frustrating.
I feel it too. The pain of the incomplete.
When can we fulfil The Great Becoming?
Now. Now, we feed.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 9: INT. COTTAGE, IVY’S BEDROOM
(FX: MECHANICAL CLOCK TICKS. WIND HOWLS OUTSIDE. IVY MOANS GENTLY, DELIRIOUS)
(FX: TAPPING GENTLY AT DOOR, THEN PUSHING IT FULLY OPEN) Ivy? Ivy?
(IN BED, AFRAID, WEAK) Who is that? Stay away!
(APPROACHING BED) My name is Nyssa. I’ve come to see if I can help. What is the nature of your illness?
“Nyssa”, ma’am? Where might a name like that be from?
Oh, a long way away.
Foreign lands, eh? I never seen ‘em. Never will.
NYSSA3: You don’t know that for sure.
I always liked the sound of France. But (GENTLE LAUGH) it might as well be the moon. Still, a good life. Yes, good enough for Ivy Cobham. (BEAT) You’ve a kind face, ma’am. Come closer.
It must be a great comfort that you and Emily are still living together.
(CONFUSED) .. What’s that you say, ma’am?
You and Emily. I just mean: some sisters might have gone their separate ways by now.
I.. I don’t know no Emily, ma’am. And I never had a sister.
But — she’s your twin.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 18
(ALARMED) My twin? No, ma’am, don’t say that. I thought they were just bad dreams!
NYSSA3: What dreams?
One of those dreams where you can’t move. And there were demons. Terrible demons: so calm, raking their fingers through my mind...
FX: FINGERS SLOWLY TAP ON WINDOW-GLASS
(SOTTO) What was that-?
Something... someone at the window.
It’s windy outside, I’m sure it was just a branch.
But — but there’s no tree past the glass. (ALARM) Please! No! Stay away from the curtains!
(STEELING HERSELF) I’ve had enough of being afraid.
My nerves can’t take it. Please don’t open ‘em!
I’m sorry.
FX: CURTAINS ARE YANKED APART
(GASPS) There is! There’s someone! By all the saints, who is
it-?
(UNNERVED) It’s... it’s me.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 19
SCENE 10: INT. COTTAGE — MAIN ROOM
FX: EMILY STOKING FIRE
There, sir. Now the fire will last all night.
(MUSING) “Improbable”.
I assure ye it will.

No, Emily: you called the Hopkins and Stearne ghost stories “improbable”. Where did you learn a word like that? I mean, I find it a touch improbable that you would use it. Not because you lack the intelligence to employ it, but because it sits badly in your mouth. Almost as if someone else was saying it. Someone else, letting themselves slip.
Pardon me, sir?
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 11: INT. IVY’S BEDROOM
FX: CLONE NYSSA TAPS AT THE WINDOW AGAIN
Ma’am, this is a devil, come to trick us, or worse. She looks
all... burned, but she has your eyes.
No. She’s half me. Almost as if she’s half-developed.
Get away from that window, ma’am.
(TO CLONE NYSSA AT WINDOW) Hello? What do you want?
I begs thee, get away!
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 21
SCENE 12: INT. COTTAGE — MAIN ROOM
FX: FIRE BURNS FULL STRENGTH
Oh, don’t pay any attention to me, Emily: perhaps it’s just the paranoia I’ve experienced. But then there’s the small matter of the Plague.
The Plague?

It’s rampant in London right now, and spreading further afield. It’s one thing to let strangers in because they sound afraid. Quite another to risk them bringing bubonic plague into your house — wouldn’t you say, ‘Emily’?
FX: FROM ADJACENT ROOM, A WINDOW SMASHES. NYSSA SCREAMS!
Nyssa!
FX: DASHES OUT, INTO:
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 13: INT. IVY’S BEDROOM (CONTINUOUS)
(FX: CLOCK TICKS. WIND LOUDER THROUGH BROKEN WINDOW. DOOR OPENS, DOCTOR RUNS IN)
(STOPPING SHORT — NYSSA’S NOT THERE) Nyssa?! Nyssa?!
(COLD, CLINICAL) The young woman has been taken.
‘Taken’? Taken where?
To a place where we can feed without interference.
I warn you now — if any harm befalls her...
There is no “if”. The probability is one hundred per cent.
Probability again. (CHECKING THE BED) I take it this is Ivy? .. Oh. No pulse.
‘Ivy’ is now an empty vessel. She has served her purpose.
This woman wasn’t your twin, was she? She was the original on which you modelled yourself!
Correct. It takes two full charges to duplicate a human.
“Charges”? You think of humans as... as batteries?
The first charge allows duplication to begin. Each template must be allowed to recover before we take the second.
I assume that’s why we were locked up in the woodshed.
You recovered from the first charge sooner than expected.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 23
So there are half-formed versions of Nyssa and I walking around out there? Well, this is all very informative, but I have to find the original Nyssa. So if you’1ll excuse me...
FX: FLINTLOCK PISTOL COCKS
Oh.
You were incorrect to say that this weapon would be unnecessary.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 14: EXT. RIVER BANK
(FX: SPEERA-ASSIMILATION HUM THROUGHOUT. STREAM RUNS NEARBY,
WHISTLES. )
BEING GRIPPED TIGHTLY, BEING SLOWLY DRAINED OF ENERGY
Please, just let me go.
Ninety-eight per cent of your body is now paralysed. Escape is impossible, unless you roll down the bank into the water. I shall not allow this to happen.
What are you doing to me?
Draining you of your life-force. Assimilating your genetic data. Adopting your identity. The first charge gave us your basic body structure.
And now you’re taking my mind?
Correct. Our invasion will require stealth. It is necessary for us to adopt both the outward appearance of humankind, and its internal characteristics.
And what happens to me after this?
Precisely what happened to the human, Ivy.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 15: INT. COTTAGE — MAIN ROOM
FX: FIRE BURNS FULL STRENGTH
I don’t suppose you’1ll pay any mind to the humble suggestion that you pack up and head home?
The Speera will never retreat. Please stand by the fire, where I can see you.

Tell me... why did you invent an Emily, when we arrived? I’m guessing you drew upon poor Ivy’s memories — perhaps memories of how she behaved when she had visitors before. But why bother? You could have just paralysed us and got it over with.
Biding time. Controlling you. Waiting for you to recharge. We have discovered that one hundred per cent of humans cannot recharge when immobilized.
Remarkably fond of figures, aren’t you.
Numbers yield precision. Precision yields results.
Which mean nothing, compared to respecting life.
You respect life in all its forms?
I do. Well, unless you happen to have an eye-stalk and a habit of exterminating galaxies.
The Speera do not. This world will be sufficient for us to flourish. Therefore, you must respect us and our intention to assimilate the entire population.
Logically, that should be true. In reality, however, I’m going to walk out of the front door. Goodbye.
Stop! I will use this device.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 26
No. No, you won’t kill me. There’s nothing like death to bring about a one hundred per cent energy loss. And with me dead, you won’t be able to finish the process of...
FX: FRONT DOOR BURSTS OPEN
(SURPRISED BY HIS CLONE) .. assimilating me. Oh. Hello. My clone-self, I presume?
You are my template. When assimilation is complete, I will be indistinguishable from you.
Apart from the fact that I’1ll be dead?
Surrender yourself to The Great Becoming, Doctor!
Thanks awfully, but I rather think I’1ll resist it instead. Stand aside, Doctor.
Your failure to resist the first charge was precisely one hundred per cent.
F/X: CLONE DOCTOR WALKS IN WITH FRANKENSTEIN-CLOMPS
I have a rule to never be paralysed twice in one day. So I’m
afraid I must be off.
This door is the only way out.
You’re forgetting the broken window in Ivy’s room. Goodbye!
FX: DOCTOR RUNS ACROSS ROOM, EXITS
After him!
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 16: EXT. RIVER BANK
FX: RIVER, WIND
Assimilation seventy-two per cent complete.
Please... stop...
It is too late. Your mind is opening up to me. Your memories.
I will fight this with everything I have.
(CURIOUS) I feel... I feel the sun on my skin.
NYSSA3: What?
I play in the endless gardens. Warm seasons seem to last forever.
You’re inside my mind!
Sunrise and sunset, my favourite times of day. When my father is home —
Don’t you dare speak of him!
When my father is home, we sit together in the Grove. We watch the sun. I am happy.
Stop this.
I study and achieve. Father’s face, so proud. One day, he disappears forever. So does my world. But now I have a new home, a new [father —]
Get out of my head!
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 28
Assimilation seventy-nine per cent complete.
(WEAK) No...
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) Take your hand off her neck and step away.
(ALMOST SOUNDING LIKE NYSSA NOW) Doctor, what’s the matter?
Don’t be ridiculous — you’re still not fully formed. Anyone can see who the real Nyssa is. Take your hand away.
Doctor, you’re scaring me.
And you’re underestimating the momentum generated by a well- placed (EFFORT, SHOVING HER) shove.
NYSSAs: Aaaah!
FX: CLONE NYSSA HITS GROUND, ROLLS DOWN RIVER BANK. SPLASH!
Good timing.
If you say so. It struck me as rather last-minute. Let’s (STRAINING) carry you back to the TARDIS, shall we?
How deep is the river?
One way to find out. (FX: SPLASHES AS DOCTOR RUNS ACROSS KNEE-
RIVER) We need to regroup and find a way to stop the Speera.
(RISING OUT OF WATER, OFF) There shall be no escape.
Doctor! The other me! She’s coming after us!
(RUNNING) Never look back, Nyssa. It’s always worked for me.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 29
FX: SPLASHES STOP
(RUNNING) There! We can move faster on dry land. Just have to keep going and... (STOPS RUNNING, CRESTFALLEN) Ahhh.
(ABOVE THEM) Stop. You will stop. You shall not escape.
You shall not pass. [ETC]
Doctor, there’s more of them! They’re all around us!
Yes. (ALOUD) The villagers of Red Lodge, I presume-?

(STEPPING FORWARD) What made you think you were different from the other ninety-eight per cent of humans in this experimental area? (TO OTHERS) Bring them back to Red Lodge. We shall end this on the village green.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 30
SCENE 17: EXT. VILLAGE GREEN
FX: FADE UP
(BEING MARCHED FORWARD) Nyssa, I’m really very sorry about this.
(DITTO) It’s not your fault, Doctor.
(DITTO) It’s always my fault.
My brethren! Abandon your positions and gather ‘round. The first stage of the invasion of our new home planet reaches its conclusion.
The Great Becoming! The Great Becoming! The Great Becoming!
CONTINUES IN BACKGROUND
Please, just let us go.
Death shall be your freedom. Your Speera-twins will now enjoy their final feed, that they may become whole.
(ADVANCING) This time, we will not be interrupted.
Stay back! Please!
Assimilating now.
FX: SPEERA ASSIMILATION-HUM, CONTINUES THROUGHOUT
Assimilating now. Soon, I shall access the memory store.
(EFFORT, BEING DRAINED) So... “experimental area”. This is a test-run? For the full invasion?
Correct. With you and the girl, we now have one hundred human test-conversions.
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 31
(SOTTO) Doctor, they still think we’re human.
So one of us is the hundredth? Surely we should win a prize. No? Still, it’s all about the taking part.
Silence, fool.
(ALOUD) The Doctor is definitely more foolish than the average human. Your experimental findings should back that up.
What do you mean?
(PERPLEXED) Yes, Nyssa, whatever do you mean?
(ALOUD) Just that the average human lacks extreme failings. Mentally, they are neither too foolish nor too clever for their own good. Physically, neither weak nor muscle-bound.
Are you going anywhere in particular with this?
Be quiet. Gaining access to memory store.
Kindly stop referring to my brain as a “memory store”.
(ALOUD) Emily, if you had any kind of worthwhile army, it would replicate the average human paradigm. It would merge the strengths of each gender. Thankfully, that’s beyond your pathetic capability.
How wrong you are. The mighty Speera can utilize its gathered data however it chooses. (TO CROWD) Silence, my brethren.
FX: CROWD CHANT STOPS
Let us show them before they die. We shall collate our findings and adopt the statistically average human form.
Nyssa, why are you helping them?
THE DEMONS OF RED LODGE by Jason Arnopp (FINAL) Page 32
Because... my heart’s in the right place. Just like yours.
We shall now transform.
(GETTING IT) Ah. Emily, this mightn’t be such a good idea.
Spare us your reverse psychology, Doctor. Your friend’s loose tongue will aid our triumph over humanity.
It really won’t. Please, there’s still a chance —
That is enough!
I am inside the Doctor’s memory store. Wait. There is something [wrong] -
Cease assimilation, both of you! (FX: SPEERA TRANSFORMATION-
STOPS.) Their minds can wait - we have their bodies. (TO
CROWD) The rest of you — link hands! Reassimilate! Regress to the human mean!
